titleStmt.title: Man, before the rage of
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). notesStmt.note: Although they are written in free verse, both the conventional nature of these lines and the handwriting suggest an early date of inscription.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Man, before the rage of whose passions
bibl.orgName: Papers of Walt Whitman (MSS 3829), Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Albert H. Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.l:
Man, before the rage of whose passions
the storms of Heaven are but a breath;

Before whose caprices the lightning is
slow and less fatal:

Man, microcosm of all Creation's wildness,
terror, beauty and power,

And whose folly and wickedness are in
nothing else existent.—
